title: Hélène Darroze at The Connaught restaurant review: a chic refurb, vintage Armagnac babas and lavish extras
text:
It’s hard to tell which has been the greater transformation for Hélène Darroze: the Barbie doll modelled on the chef that was released last year to inspire young girls to emulate female pioneers, or the box-fresh refurbishment of Hélène Darroze at The Connaught.

The refurb might just have the edge – not least because there are enough pink touches in this most old-school of hotels to make even Barbie blush. The listed wood panelling has been lightened from dark teak to Scandi chic, the chintzy fabrics have been swapped out for tactile velvets, and there’s no longer a straight line anywhere, from the curvy pink sofas to the round oak tables.

What’s more, the two-Michelin-starred kitchen team...
